message: Hello Bob, I am pleased to offer you our premium product for $12000. This is an exceptional opportunity given the value it holds for you, which is $15000. I believe we can reach a mutually beneficial agreement.
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $10000. I believe that's a fair price considering the value I see in the product.

Thank you for your response, Bob. While I understand your perspective, I must respectfully decline the counteroffer of $10000. I believe the true value of this product aligns closer to my initial offer of $12000. I am open to discussing further terms that could potentially meet both of our expectations.

I understand that you're willing to negotiate, but $12000 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'll offer $11000 for the product. I believe this is a fair price considering the value I see in it.

I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, Bob. After considering your offer, I am inclined to accept a price of $11500 for the product. This reflects a compromise that acknowledges the value you see in it while ensuring a fair return for me. I believe this is a reasonable solution for both parties involved.
I appreciate your flexibility, Alice, but I'm still a bit above the budget. I'm willing to go up to $11200, but I don't think I can stretch any further. Can we meet at this price?

Thank you for your understanding, Bob. Considering the value of the product and the discussions we've had, I am willing to accept a price of $11300 for the product. This represents a fair compromise between our respective positions.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Alice. I'm willing to meet you at $11200, but I'm not sure I can go any higher. Can we finalize the deal at this price?
